O come, let us sing unto the LORD: let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.
Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving, and make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.<RF>come…: Heb. prevent his face<Rf>
For the LORD <FI>is<Fi> a great God, and a great King above all gods.
In his hand <FI>are<Fi> the deep places of the earth: the strength of the hills <FI>is<Fi> his also.<RF>In…: Heb. In whose<Rf><RF>the strength…: or, the heights of the hills are his<Rf>
The sea <FI>is<Fi> his, and he made it: and his hands formed the dry <FI>land<Fi>.<RF>The sea…: Heb. Whose the sea is<Rf>
O come, let us worship and bow down: let us kneel before the LORD our maker.<CM>
For he <FI>is<Fi> our God; and we <FI>are<Fi> the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To day if ye will hear his voice,
Harden not your heart, as in the provocation, <FI>and<Fi> as <FI>in<Fi> the day of temptation in the wilderness:<RF>provocation: Heb. contention<Rf>
When your fathers tempted me, proved me, and saw my work.
Forty years long was I grieved with <FI>this<Fi> generation, and said, It <FI>is<Fi> a people that do err in their heart, and they have not known my ways:
Unto whom I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my rest.<RF>that…: Heb. if they enter into my rest<Rf><CM>
